item.title: Configuring DHCP Relays and Servers
item.description: You can configure an interface so it can make DHCP relay requests for IPv4 and IPv6. To run DHCP for both IPv4 and IPv6, you need to initiate the DHCP relay and DHCP server twice: once for IPv4 and once for IPv6. item.title: Network Command Line Utility
item.description: Early Access Feature nclu is an early access feature in Cumulus Linux 3.1. Before you can install nclu, you must enable the Early Access repository. For more information about the Cumulus Linux repository, read this knowledge base article. The Network Command Line Utility, or NCLU, is a command line interface for Cumulus Networks products, implemented in Cumulus Linux and VX 3.1 and later releases, with the goal of simplifying the networking configuration process for all users.
